title: High Dependency on Foreign Aid
description: In 2020, Somalia received foreign aid equivalent to 16,588,979% of its central government expenses, indicating a significant reliance on international assistance.

title: Complete Multilateral Debt Service
description: In 2023, 100% of Somalia's public and publicly guaranteed debt service was dedicated to multilateral debt, highlighting a heavy financial obligation.

title: Predominant Agricultural Water Use
description: In 2021, 99.48% of Somalia's freshwater withdrawals were used for agriculture, underscoring the sector's dominance in water consumption.

title: High Customs and Import Duties
description: In 2023, customs and other import duties accounted for 67.57% of Somalia's tax revenue, indicating a significant reliance on trade taxes.

title: Severe Particulate Emission Damage
description: In 2021, particulate emission damage accounted for 7.09% of Somalia's GNI, reflecting substantial environmental challenges.

title: High Prevalence of Female Genital Mutilation
description: In 2020, 99.2% of females in Somalia were subjected to genital mutilation, indicating a critical human rights issue.

title: Widespread Undernourishment
description: In 2022, 51.3% of Somalia's population was undernourished, highlighting a severe food security crisis.

title: High Fertility Rate
description: In 2023, Somalia's fertility rate was 6.13 births per woman, one of the highest globally, indicating rapid population growth.

title: Large Young Female Population
description: In 2023, 18.32% of Somalia's female population was aged 0-4, reflecting a youthful demographic.

title: Dependence on Imports from Developing Economies
description: In 2023, 75.32% of Somalia's merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies outside its region, indicating trade reliance.

title: Strong Trade Ties with the Arab World
description: In 2023, 90.84% of Somalia's merchandise exports were directed to the Arab World, showcasing significant regional trade connections.

title: Lowest Revenue Generation Relative to GDP
description: In 2023, Somalia's revenue, excluding grants, accounted for a mere 0.00011% of its GDP, indicating a significant challenge in generating domestic revenue.

title: Minimal Tax Revenue Contribution
description: Somalia's tax revenue in 2023 was only 0.00008% of GDP, highlighting a critical weakness in tax collection and fiscal capacity.

title: Low Educational Attainment
description: As of 2022, only 15.5% of the population aged 25+ had completed primary education, with a mere 7.21% of females achieving this level.

title: Limited Preprimary School Enrollment
description: In 2021, preprimary school enrollment was extremely low, with only 1.15% of children enrolled, indicating challenges in early childhood education.

title: Low Health Expenditure Per Capita
description: In 2022, Somalia's current health expenditure per capita was just $15.35, reflecting limited investment in healthcare services.

title: Limited Prenatal Care Access
description: Only 31.1% of pregnant women received prenatal care in 2019, highlighting significant gaps in maternal health services.

title: Low Contraceptive Prevalence
description: In 2019, only 6.9% of married women aged 15-49 used any contraceptive method, indicating challenges in family planning services.

title: Minimal Trademark Applications by Nonresidents
description: In 2021, there were only 140 trademark applications by nonresidents, suggesting limited foreign business interest.

title: Low Rule of Law and Governance
description: Somalia's rule of law estimate in 2023 was -2.21, reflecting significant challenges in governance and legal frameworks.

title: High External Balance Deficit
description: In 2023, Somalia's external balance on goods and services was a deficit of -162,215,385,473,200 LCU, indicating economic challenges.
